definition[0]: to make a document, ticket, claim etc no longer legally or officially acceptable
example[0]: Failure to disclose all relevant changes may invalidate your policy.
definition[1]: to show that something such as a belief or explanation is wrong
definition[2]: to make a contract, agreement, document etc invalid
example[2]: Failure to follow the instructions correctly could invalidate the guarantee.
example[3]: The Judge’s ruling invalidated the company’s patent.
